website_summaries.verdict: One of the most simple stand and organization solutions for a single monitor and desk setup. Perfect for organizing a messy, cluttered office environment.
pros: Plenty of space on the top of the stand stabilizes the monitor while in use
Great organization in the drawer underneath
cons: Takes up more desk space than other similar single shelf options

customer_reviews.title: Economical and Practical Stand
customer_reviews.text: I saw no problems with flexing under the weight of my 24" monitor. Drawers opened and closed smoothly. This stand fit my needs perfectly, providing height and storage economically. With risers, height was ~ 4 1/8"; without, 2.5.
customer_reviews.author: Ryder

customer_reviews.title: Works, but kinda cheap
customer_reviews.text: This product works, but isn't the best quality. The drawers don't seem to line up right and are difficult to open. Also, some of the pieces almost seem disconnected from each other and the legs bend easily... it would probably be easy to pull the whole thing apart. The materials just seem cheap, but I guess that's to be expected considering it's the cheapest one I could find (still not sure why these are ever more that $10). It does work for what I want it for and I will be keeping it for sure, but if you're looking for durability and a nicer-looking stand, maybe go for a more expensive one.
customer_reviews.author: Lindsay S.

customer_reviews.title: Naw, just doesn't have enough umph to function as represented
customer_reviews.text: Super-duper flimsy, thin, bends with even laptop weight, and then I can't open the center drawer. It doesn't have enough weight enough to stay in place, plus the little feet don't stay in, which makes it really difficult to use as a touch screen loptop stand/ergonomic lift (I have a wireless keyboard, so there isn't much movement). It's a cool design, layout, just wished they constructed it with a bit more heartiness. After I glued the feet, distributed the weight with a stand, and have a non-slip liner under the feet I can use it, but I gave up using the drawers, they stick and then all the little things inside get messed up.
customer_reviews.author: Rebecca

customer_reviews.title: Keeps my desk clean and neat. Lovce it!
customer_reviews.text: I really like this monitor stand. I added the feet so that the little drawers can open up above my keyboard. It's great and has plenty of space for all my office supplies that use to sit in various spots on my desk. I love having everything organized and clean now. The only down side, is that the drawers don't have an easy glide which you can feel and some times I have to kind of realign one of them to get it to close fully.
customer_reviews.author: Jocey

customer_reviews.title: Fits my workspace perfectly!
customer_reviews.text: I don't always review, but if I do, it is because a product left an impression with me.... good or bad. I am pleasantly pleased with this item. I had concerns that it would not effectively support my heavy old monitor. There are middle support legs, and that eliminated that concern. I'm not a fan of the hard plastic. I'm sure that is what makes this affordable and sturdy enough to hold a monitor. It fits my workspace perfectly.
customer_reviews.author: TSC Awareness

customer_reviews.title: Decent product for the price.
customer_reviews.text: Kinda cheap, plastic construction. But you get what you pay for. It does the job for me, holds my pens and supplies, with feet attached drawers open over keyboard and it supports my monitor just fine. Overall very happy.
customer_reviews.author: Eric Petty

customer_reviews.title: Appropriate quality for the price
customer_reviews.text: For $17 I wasn't expecting much but if it were a little beefier and the handle finish didn't chip away already I'd give it 4 stars. So I'm giving it 2.5 stars rounded up to 3 stars. It's lightweight and feels cheap and plasticky but I wasn't expecting it to feel like mahogany. It's light enough where when you try to adjust the monitor this moves with it as well. The feet need some rubber bottoms to stop slipping. Also as I mentioned the shiny chrome finish/stickers on the handles are already peeling off with only light use.
customer_reviews.author: S. Tam

customer_reviews.title: Exceptionally cheap materials
customer_reviews.text: Could have been a decent product, but the plastics are of horrible quality. The entire unit is discolored "white" and the drawers are even worse in their discoloration; meaning the drawers don't match each other nor do they match the main unit. In addition, the drawer movement is to the point of silly. In terms of design, the depth of the unit is too great, as it takes up superfluous space on the desk. A shorter-in-depth, painted, metal version would be a better option.
customer_reviews.author: MESC

customer_reviews.title: Better than I expected for the price!!
customer_reviews.text: This handy little tool is wonderfully easy to set up -- because of the weight of the monitor I place on top of it - I needed to use 4 of the 8 plastic legs for support in the center of the shelf - so could only lift it up one leg-height. But I love it!! The drawers slide easily and are as deep as the shelf! Lots of storage space. My desk is neater and tidier and my monitor is raised closer to eye-level, for better ergonomics = less HEADACHES! I am thrilled with this purchase and find it to be very budget-friendly!
customer_reviews.author: Kiera.Wells

customer_reviews.title: Drawers do not glide open
customer_reviews.text: This is okay and does a decent enough job holding a lot of smaller things that I needed a place for in my office; however, it is cheap feeling/looking and I had to glue the legs on because every time it shifted (which it does frequently when I try to slide a drawer open), they would fall off. As for the drawers -- they do not glide well. I have to hold onto the top to keep from pulling the entire thing off the desk, when pulling open a drawer. Overall, I'm not overly thrilled with this item, but until I find something similar/better, I've at least something to keep some of my smaller office supplies in.
customer_reviews.author: Romantic

customer_reviews.title: Great Monitor Risers
customer_reviews.text: These monitor risers are an awesome addition to my work-from-home space. They keep my monitor and laptop at the right height so my neck doesn’t strain and the organizer drawers keep my supplies nearby and out of view. My only beef is the legs: they come off easily, so if you try to adjust the monitor, they break off. There are a lot of legs to keep track of! I am a little wary of their long term sturdiness, but I am hoping my situation isn’t TOO long term.
customer_reviews.author: RGLTO

customer_reviews.title: Great drawers for a laptop of light monitor
customer_reviews.text: I really like this monitor stand. I use it for a laptop so it's plenty sturdy and the drawers are perfect for what I needed. When I first set it up i didn't put the legs under it and it was great! it didn't slide on my desk at all. I gave it 4 stars because when you put the legs on it there is no traction. Easily fixed but it would be nice it there was a little traction on the bottom of the feet. Aside from that I'm very happy with it.
customer_reviews.author: Kim Huggins

customer_reviews.title: Drawers have a good capacity - can fit scissors/stapler along with the pens ...
customer_reviews.text: Stable and the height is adjustable by adding / taking away a peg from each of the 4 legs. Drawers have a good capacity - can fit scissors/stapler along with the pens etc. Only complaint is it is hard to move because they legs fall out / collapse easy. Drawers open and close well - still getting a plastic quality item; holds up a computer monitor but if you want something super stable you can move around maybe not the best product for heavy weight items. Phone, laptops are no issue as far as weight.
customer_reviews.author: Michelle R. Heil

customer_reviews.title: Very sturdy
customer_reviews.text: The stand is very sturdy. I has feet on the ends and also in the middle. The drawers are really nice to keep things handy. It is large, so keep in mind if you do anything at your desk with a regular size notebook, planners etc, you may not have the room to do those things, depending on the size of your desk. For me, that is a minor issue. It does hold the moniter rather high, but this helps me with slouching, which is a good thing.
customer_reviews.author: Kirk Wheeler

customer_reviews.title: Handy, helpful laptop perch
customer_reviews.text: I got this for my desktop computer at work so that it was more at eye level to prevent neck/shoulder strain and it is definitely helpful. It’s sturdy enough for the price. It’s basically plastic but it serves its purpose and the 3 small drawers underneath hold smaller items like post its , pens, etc. which is convenient. I was worried it wouldn’t be large enough or sturdy enough but it is. The little legs are removable as well if you wanted to lower it. Definitely worth it.
customer_reviews.author: Renee C

customer_reviews.title: Drawer plus PC monitor stand
customer_reviews.text: 1- no assembly required 2- drawers are deep lengthwise, but shallow height wise and suitable for small office items such as paper clips, binder clips, thumb tacks, pencils, erasers, etc. 3- the leg attachments give additional height, but looks funky. 4- this is relatively small stand for PC monitors and will not give you much space on top. Happy with purchase, fair price.
customer_reviews.author: no-nonsense

customer_reviews.title: a bit weak in construction
customer_reviews.text: I put my mac 27" on top of monitor stand. If you want to put the keyboard under the monitor you have to take off the middle legs which now make the monitor sag. If you leave them on it works great. My original review did not mention that, so it is actually my fault that the monitor sags, due to me wanting to put my keyboard under monitor. I think a reinforcement under the draws would have solved the problem, but I guess that is why it was cheap. Ok though, I am satisfied, but could have been better
customer_reviews.author: BL

customer_reviews.title: best stand for any computer system
customer_reviews.text: Order this not really knowing what I was getting. I was surprised to see that it holds my monitor super well and love the fact, I now can hind my other items off my desk in the drawers. I highly recommend this to anyone who wish to have a clean desk. And love the fact it raises the monitor up to eye level. First time in years, my neck didn't hurt after working 12 hours at the computer
customer_reviews.author: aron austin

customer_reviews.title: Holds my stand but it it is plastic. Very useful drawers
customer_reviews.text: Monitor Stand organizer. I didn’t even put the feet on it. One of my stands seemed to put some weight on middle so check the weight distribution of the base. This is just plastic with a few drawers. I put it under a monitor maybe 21-23” I’m not sure. If you’re monitor or stand is heavier I’d go with metal. For the price it’s great for me I always have too many Knick knacks on the table. The drawers creek, like I said it’s a plastic shelf. Don’t expect heavy items to hold up but it’s been a great convenience to me.
customer_reviews.author: SF GTR

customer_reviews.title: Not bad if you don't intend to use the legs
customer_reviews.text: Not bad if you don't intend to use the legs. If you move it slightly, the legs fall off and I almost dropped a brand new monitor. Do not buy this unless you are going to put it flat on the desk.
customer_reviews.author: Carole P. Bronico

customer_reviews.title: The only reason that I have given it 4 stars instead of 5 is because it could be a little more sturdy. The plastic that it is made of could ...
customer_reviews.text: This is very functional & works perfectly as I had planned to organize my desk. The only reason that I have given it 4 stars instead of 5 is because it could be a little more sturdy. The plastic that it is made of could be stronger. Having said that, it is holding my monitor well without the legs attached. I feel like the legs make it a bit less stable.
customer_reviews.author: Kristal

customer_reviews.title: Great Value.
customer_reviews.text: Works well for what I needed. The quality is a little cheesy, but for the $, a good value. As a stand for my monitor it's great. I wish there was a little more flexibility in the drawers - I'd prefer more long, open drawers for pens, markers etc., and the little dividers are not removable - but that being said, it's a great value for the $.
customer_reviews.author: Bob

customer_reviews.title: Okay product, but cheap legs.
customer_reviews.text: If you are choosing to use the legs included with this product, please beware. I had to use super glue to make them actually attach properly to the storage unit. Also, if you have a keyboard that sits on your desk as opposed to its own shelf, you will not be able to use this product with the legs properly as it will hit the keyboard.
customer_reviews.author: S. Rose

customer_reviews.title: 2 Months In and Still Loving!
customer_reviews.text: I’ve had these for a little over 2 months now. They work perfectly. I bought them for work, to better organize our cashwrap area, and they’ve been ideal! The drawers pull out easily, they are nice and deep so we can store pens, box cutters, highlighters, extra scotch tape, etc inside them! Would definitely buy again if I needed another one.
customer_reviews.author: Katherine Wise

customer_reviews.title: Love it
customer_reviews.text: I had to replace a keyboard tray that was over sized and had a place behind the keyboard to store pencils, clips, etc. When that fell apart (after more than 15 years), I could not find another one as large. So I decided to replace the tray with the largest one I could find, and accommodate my *stuff* with this little 3-drawer gem. It works great, I love it, and best of all my grandson isn't always into my lovely *stuff*. Ha.
customer_reviews.author: Susie, Olympia WA

customer_reviews.title: I bought these for my office and they've been great so far
customer_reviews.text: I bought these for my office and they've been great so far. Everyone loves them and nobody believes the price. They allow ample storage. The only "flaw" is that my desk is really slippery and there's no way to anchor the stands. Since the feet are oddly shaped, I can't use a felt pad under each leg but I ended up setting a no-skid pad under them.
customer_reviews.author: CP83

customer_reviews.title: Works Well with My Monitor
customer_reviews.text: I bought two of these, to get the height that I wanted, and have a 32" computer monitor atop them. They're plenty sturdy, stay in place well, and have lots of storage for all those small things cluttering up my computer area. Of course, I forget it's there, and don't always put things away (my wife made me say that).
customer_reviews.author: RickR

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy and Practical.
customer_reviews.text: This monitor stand is just what I needed. Now I have desk items like pens and paper clips tucked away under the monitor. The feet elevate it over a standard keyboard. Unfortunately I have a taller ergonomic keyboard so the drawers sometimes run into it but it's a minor inconvenience for the organization this offers.
customer_reviews.author: Michele

customer_reviews.title: Splurge and get something $10 nicer
customer_reviews.text: The feet that push into small holes on the bottom buckle and it’s just not as sturdy as I had hoped. You could superglue them in and you’d be fine. Plastic is cheap plastic and it feels every bit of it. The drawers slide out ok and it’ll hold stuff, for the price, could have been better. Would not buy again.
customer_reviews.author: Jason

customer_reviews.title: Average little stand, watch the legs!
customer_reviews.text: I have to factor in cost, this was cheap. I wasn't expecting solid wood with silver handles or anything. But with the legs on, it is super sketchy. If I don't move to fast it's okay ha ha. Monitor almost took a tumble one day, legs just don't go in a good way to be secure and one just gave out. I don't even use the drawers and the metal paint is flaking. It looks alright though, sans legs I bet it would be alright. Had to knock a few stars for the legs and the chipping paint after few a few months.
customer_reviews.author: KO

customer_reviews.title: Nice Product
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this for my new riser desk and I wanted something that didn't take up too much room. This item is perfect as my computer screen stands on top of it, and then the drawers can be used for storage of the essential items you need to work at your desk. Color matched my screen too :-) Great product.
customer_reviews.author: Richard Quintanilla

customer_reviews.title: Is everthing I thought I would get
customer_reviews.text: Funny I bought a new TV for the bedroom that had legs on each end instead of one center leg because it had the same size screen but looked less bulky. The Trouble was the cable box didn't fit underneath the new TV. I needed something the same height so the TV could sit on the cable box at one end and this on the other. This worked perfect and the storage now holds the remotes so I never lose them.
customer_reviews.author: Charles Martino

customer_reviews.title: Great purchase for neck pain !
customer_reviews.text: Great product to raise computer - my neck and shoulder hurts from the constant use of computer and having to look down. This riser raises my computer to a great level - also love the drawers to store USB drives and other items for easy access. It has feet that you can add on or remove to adjust the height.
customer_reviews.author: Coy K.

customer_reviews.title: Just a little more space and height..
customer_reviews.text: Love this. I just started my new job in an ENT medical office coding. I purchased this to get my monitor up a little and give me extra space under it. Love it. Our Business Office Manager came in and was checking it out.. She loved it.. She is afraid others will thing she ordered for me. But it was economical enough that I didn't even think of asking the manager to pay for it. I wouldn't say no to being refunded.. but, it was worth the money.
customer_reviews.author: D.Lynne

customer_reviews.title: Flimsy
customer_reviews.text: Made the decision to return this item about 30 seconds after I unpacked it. Took this product out of the packaging sleeve and immediately noticed the sharp plastic edges and seams from how the drawers are constructed. The drawer fronts were not square and did not line up when they were shut. This is thin, cheap plastic, that when the weight of the (flat-screen) moniter is on, compresses the drawers and they cannot slide in and out. Save your money and buy something else.
customer_reviews.author: Basemmel99

customer_reviews.title: Organizes your desk - keeps clutter away.
customer_reviews.text: A nice organizer for pens, paperclips, and little pads of paper. Lifts the monitor up slightly or more so if you attach the feet. We didn't need the feet, so we just tossed them, but they would be good for some. This item is plastic and appears to be well-made, although since it is plastic it is not the nicest looking - but it works and was a fair price so I'm happy.
customer_reviews.author: Dog Lover

customer_reviews.title: Giving my laptop a lift
customer_reviews.text: The product is as described, and looks like the photo. The only complaint that I have is that the feet fall out of the slots on the bottom. They don't snap in, they just slide in, so nothing holding them when you lift it up. Otherwise, it is a really great item, and allows me to keep things close by when I need a thumb drive, pen, ear buds, etc.
customer_reviews.author: mccool

customer_reviews.title: Keep overhead height in mind with small space storage.
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this to add extra height to my desktop computer (I stand at my desk a lot) and storage for a small desk space. The storage drawers are perfect for pens, paperclips, binder clips and other smalls. The only caution I have is make sure that you have plenty of clearance if your monitor is up under overhead cabinets. I couldn't use the risers (or feet) because there wasn't enough height but the drawers still open and close smoothly.
customer_reviews.author: Amanda

customer_reviews.title: Great storage
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this for my husband's pc - to allow convenient storage closeby as he also runs his ham radio set up from his desktop. It fits perfectly under the base of his 32" monitor and the drawers are easy to pull out without being in the way of other work. Very reasonable price!
customer_reviews.author: Teris

customer_reviews.title: Not really “white” but it does the job!
customer_reviews.text: For the price, this is a great product! The drawers are longer than they look, so they hold quite a bit of small office supplies (including standard size post-it’s). But I will add that I don’t think the color should be considered pure “white”. It’s more off-white/beige when compared to our white desk. But even so, it looks great and it’s very useful to save space in our small corner office :)
customer_reviews.author: Brittany Burch

customer_reviews.title: Nice little stand with ample storage.
customer_reviews.text: I wasn’t in search of a stand as my monitor height is fine yet, the three drawer storage is what really brought me to purchase this stand. Between usb thumb drives, SD cards and other little gadgets about on my desk, this stand serves me well and keeps my desk tidy without tossing these smaller items in bigger desk drawers.
customer_reviews.author: Jwoods

customer_reviews.title: Monitor tray
customer_reviews.text: I would have given it 5 stars, but the legs kept falling off! Once I glued the legs in it was really sturdy, and it works!
customer_reviews.author: Marie Jones

customer_reviews.title: Neat desk now
customer_reviews.text: I didn't end up using the legs since they kept wobbling. Without it the height is perfect and my monitor is eye level. The drawers are deep and all my desk clutter is out of sight. The silver pulls are attractive and well constructed. instead of the legs, get 2 and stack them if you need it higher.
customer_reviews.author: Jasmine

customer_reviews.title: LOVE!
customer_reviews.text: Got my new monitor stand today and I love it! The drawers have plenty of space and I like the dividers in the drawers. The legs are a little sketchy - they will bend and probably break if you slide it over. I think white looks great! The middle drawer has a small spot on it - came out of the box like that, but nothing to get upset about.
customer_reviews.author: c stephens

customer_reviews.title: Great size, great price
customer_reviews.text: This is exactly what I was looking for to organize and de-clutter my desktop! It raised my monitor to just the right level so I no longer have a neck ache from looking down. It doesn't take up a lot of space, and the drawers are long and hold a lot more then I could have imagined. (I didn't use the enclosed add-on legs because the stand was perfect out of the box. I am very happy with my purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Linda S

customer_reviews.title: Great little stand!
customer_reviews.text: Drawers are wonderful since I don't have any drawers on my desk. They pull out all the way so you can use all the space that's provided. The separate sections are nice to be able to store different little items, and there are larger sections in the back that I can even fit my computer mouse in if I'm packing up my desk. I'm not using the feet that are provided, but they all attach and detach easily.
customer_reviews.author: Katye Broach

customer_reviews.title: It is a good stand for the money.
customer_reviews.text: Definitely worth what I paid for it. I installed the removable legs so that I could open the drawers without having to move my keyboard. The legs break easily, though, so I ended up removing them and putting the drawers on top of a paper drawer to raise the laptop to the correct height. I wish it was 2 inches wider so that it could securely hold my 15 inch MacBook Pro. Right now it hangs over the sides.
customer_reviews.author: MiniFlynny

customer_reviews.title: Flimsy!!!!!!
customer_reviews.text: Stay far away, this thing is flimsy as hell, can barely hold 5 pounds before bowing or breaking. It's absolute garbage.
customer_reviews.author: R. Windsor

customer_reviews.title: Where were you?
customer_reviews.text: Just what I needed! sturdy, and so necessary. No real assembly required and just the right size. Stores easily and saves me tons of money. I take my dogs to the groomer 75% less often since I bought this. I bathe them myself and trim them between visits. One of the best purchases I've made. Get one!
customer_reviews.author: LOLA NJ

customer_reviews.title: This does exactly what it says it does, at the correct height for my needs, and helps me keep my desk clean and organized!
customer_reviews.text: Perfect size to lift my second monitor to the most effective height for my iMac screen, and I LOVE the drawers underneath! I have never had any issues with them sticking, or not closing properly as some of the other reviewers have stated. My drawers fit perfectly, slide in and out perfectly, and always close completely with zero issues. This fits my needs perfectly in organizing my office desk, as well as lifting my screen to the perfect height.
customer_reviews.author: TeriLynn Rao

customer_reviews.title: Highly recommend
customer_reviews.text: I love this. I bought 2 as I have two monitors at work. You can adjust the height by putting the legs on or not using them. The drawers are very deep & perfect for storing pens, pencils, highlighters. I have 1 drawer with sticky notes in it & another with paper clips. Plastic is very durable as I’m not the most gentle with opening the drawer & they never get jammed.
customer_reviews.author: Katy

customer_reviews.title: Good for the money
customer_reviews.text: The material is a little flimsy and the doors don't like to close with good fitment when there's weight on it (which there will be, obviously) but they will if you wiggle them around a bit. Regardless I like it because the stand doesn't wobble and feels stable on my desk and is a great option for the money.
customer_reviews.author: ae102

customer_reviews.title: Perfect sized storage for under my monitor.
customer_reviews.text: Nice clean look for under my monitor. Helps keep my "junk" hidden. Very clean black plastic with chrome style handles. Drawers slide well and have separator inside to organize stuff.
customer_reviews.author: A. Cruz

customer_reviews.title: Laptop stand
customer_reviews.text: This is great on any desk. I use mine to elevate my laptop but it is wise to install the feet on it (included) otherwise anything in front of it will block the drawers from opening. I love it although the drawers are somewhat narrow it is good for pens and other small desk items.
customer_reviews.author: spirithand

customer_reviews.title: Serves Its Purpose Well
customer_reviews.text: It's been great for my purposes: holding a monitor and storing some small things that clutter the desk. The unit has added layers to my desk because I put charging cables paperclips and other assorted things in the drawers, I have a computer monitor, a wireless speaker and some business cards on top, and some papers below it, between the legs. There are a lot of comments on here that the plastic is thin and flimsy, and it is pretty thin and lightweight, but the small drawers work fine with my monitor and speaker on it.
customer_reviews.author: Drew V.

customer_reviews.title: The drawers are perfect to hold small things that get lost on my ...
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this not to use as a monitor stand but to elevate my makeup mirror on my vanity. The drawers are perfect to hold small things that get lost on my vanity and a place to put my daily wear jewelry at the end of the day. I love it. I was a bit afraid it would look slightly out of place but it blended right in with my vanity and mirror and raised it up to the perfect height.
customer_reviews.author: AWagoner

customer_reviews.title: Legs break off, very easily!
customer_reviews.text: I love that I no longer have to bend my head down to see my computer at work. Its the perfect size. It will definitely work for now. But I was a little frustrated. As I put the legs on to put it under my computer, two of the legs kept falling off. Eventually, I got them back on, but they are not very sturdy that’s for sure. I guess you get what you pay for. I feel like I should have paid a little more for something higher quality. Would not purchase again.
customer_reviews.author: Madison Frederick

customer_reviews.title: Quality product to elevate my iMac and allow me to store frequently used items inside it.  Keeps desktop cleaner looking.
customer_reviews.text: I highly recommend the "Mind Reader Perch PC Laptop iMac Monitor Holder. Wasn't sure I'd feel comfortable with my heavy iMAC monitor sitting on top of it. After it arrived and I set it up, no issues. It's very sturdy and well-built, securely holds my 24 inch iMac. It's the perfect height for me ergonomically (I didn't use the included risers, it sits flat on my desk). Its nice to store things inside the 3 drawers for easy access to frequently used items (as pictured in the photo .. that's just what I store inside. Makes for a cleaner desktop. So glad I purchased this product.
customer_reviews.author: Book Lover

customer_reviews.title: Useful and durable.
customer_reviews.text: This monitor stand is very useful! I needed to raise my monitor up only a few inches, so I didn't add the option legs, but you could raise it up another inch or 2 if you add them on. The drawers hold everything I need: paperclips, business cards, binder clips, highlighters, and more. I guess my only complaint is that it could be a bit prettier looking, but it's still fine. Overall I'm very satisfied.
customer_reviews.author: Goodie12shoes

customer_reviews.title: Meh
customer_reviews.text: I was excited for this monitor stand and the organization. The legs are not sturdy and will pop out if the stand is adjusted. Plus the feet did not have any grip pads on the bottom, so it slid easily. Ended up buying a different stand.
customer_reviews.author: Melly777

customer_reviews.title: Just what I needed
customer_reviews.text: I’m really happy with this thing. It looks nice, the little drawers are handy for as few small necessities - better if you use the feet to raise the stand, otherwise they might not open as far before bumping into the keyboard. I bought 2 - used feet on one and left them off the other. Nice to have the height option. Would but again.
customer_reviews.author: Lisa

customer_reviews.title: Exactly as shown
customer_reviews.text: My monitor rest great on it. I was able to organzie my supplies better. It allowed me to optimize my desk space. And I've been able to control my cord management a little better with it, by running the mouse cord under one section and my keyboard cord through another. Also allows me to put my phone somewhere without it being in the way while I work.
customer_reviews.author: Alexandra Norine

customer_reviews.title: works PERFECT
